attributes.action: SACK Hazel Blears for avoiding capital gains tax.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: After deliberatly undertaking a complicated series of moves of her designated second home that allowed her to take advantage of looser tax rules for MPs she sold the property in south London for £200,000, about £45,000 more than she paid for it. Revenue rules at the time of the sale stated that any profit made on a second home is subject to capital gains tax at 40 per cent. Miss Blears paid no capital gains tax because she had declared the home her primary residence.

rejection.details: MPs' expenses are a matter for direct communication with Parliament. http://www.parliament.uk
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
